page.title: 04CROOKS PEAK PART 1
page.content: FROM THE LEVELS OF THE SOMERSET COUNTRYSIDE,LOCAL PEOPLE LOOKING TOWARDS THE MENDIP HILLS,INEVITABLY LOOK FOR AND POINT OUT TO THE VISITOR,CROOK PEAK.FOR A BRITISH PEAK,IT IS NOT VERY HIGH,BEING BUT 191 METRES,BUT FOR THIS AREA,IT IS THE HIGHEST PEAK.ITS DISTINCT SHAPE SITTING AS AN IRREGULAR TRIANGLE ON THE CURVE OF THE HILL TOP,ONCE SEEN IS NOT EASILY FORGOTTEN. A GENTLE UPHILL WALK FROM COMPTON BISHOP OR THE HARSHER CLIMB FROM WEBBINGTON REVEALS MAGNIFICENT VIEWS OVER THE SOMERSET COUNTRYSIDE TO THE EAST,THROUGH SOUTH TO THE WEST WITH THE BRISTOL CHANNEL AND WALES WHILE TO THE NORTH THE NEW COUNTY OF AVON IS OPENED UP.
